article_title: Secrets of Greg Abbott's hospital-funding emails
article_text:
Secrets of Greg Abbott's hospital-funding emails A critic goes on 'the list' even as Texas considers federal Medicaid funding

Photo: Deborah Cannon, AP Gov. Greg Abbott.

Shortly before 1 a.m. on July 15, Gov. Greg Abbott sent an email from his personal account to his top advisers about an opinion piece published by the Houston Chronicle's Gray Matters.

article_metadata.author.name: By Edgar Walters, The Texas Tribune

og.description: Shortly before 1 a.m. on July 15, Gov. Greg Abbott sent an email to his top advisers about an editorial published by the Houston Chronicle's Gray Matters. Its author, Ken Janda, had written that Texas' health care safety net system for the poor and uninsured was "in serious danger of meltdown." The governor told aides he wanted to "see the financials" of Janda's nonprofit.
